newsitem.title: CHINA: CHINA RPI UP 0.6 PERCENT YR/YR IN JULY.
newsitem.headline: CHINA RPI UP 0.6 PERCENT YR/YR IN JULY.

text.p: China's benchmark retail price index was up 0.6 percent year-on-year in July, state television said on Tuesday quoting figures from the State Planning Commission.
Consumer price inflation rose 2.7 percent year-on-year in July, the commission said.
That compared with retail price inflation of 0.8 percent last month and a similar 0.8 percent for May.
Consumer price inflation was 2.8 percent in May but no figure was available for June.
Retail price inflation for January-July was 1.6 percent while consumer price inflation was 3.9 percent for the period.
China's retail price index rose 6.1 percent in 1996, down from 14.8 percent in 1995 and a communist-era high of 21.7 percent in 1994.
China has forecast retail price inflation this year will be about 3.0-4.0 percent, revising an earlier target of 6.0 percent.
